qas.question: What aspect ratio was agreed upon due to the influence of widescreen cinema?
Who agreed upon the 16:9 aspect ratio?
What was a leading factor in the 16:9 aspect ratio being chosen?
Which encoding contains both progressive and interlaced content?
Which aspect ratio was the early favorite?
What aspect ratio was agreed upon due to the influence of full screen cinema?
Who agreed upon the 11:9 aspect ratio?
What was a leading factor in the 11:9 aspect ratio being chosen?
Which encoding contains both not progressive and interlaced content?
Which aspect ratio was the late favorite?

context: Initially the existing <a4_0>5:3<a4_0/> aspect ratio had been the main candidate but, due to the influence of <a2_0>widescreen cinema<a2_0/>, the aspect ratio <a0_0><b5_0>16:9<b5_0/><a0_0/> (1.78) eventually emerged as being a reasonable compromise between <b9_0>5:3<b9_0/> (1.67) and the common 1.85 <b7_0>widescreen cinema<b7_0/> format. An aspect ratio of 16:9 was duly agreed upon at the first meeting of <a1_0>the <b6_0>IWP11/6 working party<b6_0/><a1_0/> at the BBC's Research and Development establishment in Kingswood Warren. The resulting ITU-R Recommendation ITU-R BT.709-2 ("Rec. 709") includes the 16:9 aspect ratio, a specified colorimetry, and the scan modes 1080i (1,080 actively interlaced lines of resolution) and 1080p (1,080 progressively scanned lines). The British Freeview HD trials used <a3_0><b8_0>MBAFF<b8_0/><a3_0/>, which contains both progressive and interlaced content in the same encoding.
